title: "Gehört" bold condensed sans
content:
Hello,

please help me to identify the following type.  
I think it’s nothing special, but I can’t get it.

I think the “G” is interesting for identifiing?!

thanks, tobt

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [egg.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113203159/http:/typophile.com/files/egg.jpg) | 20.01 KB |

 [‹ (x) New York magazine geometric constructed display type - custom type by Omnivore {Ricardo Cordoba}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113203159/http:/typophile.com/node/38027 "Go to previous forum topic") [The Great Gatsby original book cover ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113203159/http:/typophile.com/node/38031 "Go to next forum topic")
author: tobt

comments.content: i was going to say futura bold condensed, but the G’s different.

If it’s older, perhaps a metal version of Tempo, slightly wider than [Tempo Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113203159/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/tempo_std_heavy_condensed_ot/?sample_text=GEH%C3%96RT&sample_size=36&acs_ss=-1&acs_p=1&acs_pt=24&acs=1).
